item.title: Beats Studio Buds And Studio3 Headphones Are Cheap Right Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/beats-studio-buds-and-studio3-headphones-are-cheap-right-now/1100-6528011/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A good headset feels like a necessity in the modern age, but if you're looking for something compact, there's a Black Friday deal on right now for the Beats Studio earbuds that feature active noise-cancelling technology. Normally $150, you can get these for $80, a pretty substantial savings. These are sweat-resistant earbuds as well, so if you're looking for something to use when you're at the gym, they should work nicely during a strenuous workout. You can pick between black, red, and white Studio Buds.

Beats Studio Buds

$80 (was $150)

The Beats Studio Buds are compatible with iOS, Android, and other Bluetooth-enabled devices. You can expect to get up to eight hours of listening from a full charge, or around 24 hours in total when combined with the charging case. The Class 1 Bluetooth rating means that it has an extended range when in use, it's designed to offer a powerful but balanced soundscape, and it has built-in microphones in case you need to take a call. Also worth noting is that it has active noise cancellation (ANC) and transparency modes, so you can quickly switch between them based on your needs.

There's also the higher end Beats Studio Buds+, which has a better built-in microphone and is on sale for $130 (was $170). There's even a cool transparent model.

Beats Solo 4 Wireless Headphones

$100 (was $200)

Amazon has the Beats Solo 4 for $100 (was $200). This is a solid headset with decent audio and a good, stylish build quality. The original $200 price is too high--you're paying for the brand name--but it's a good deal at $100.

The Solo 4 headphones have very good battery life. You can get up to 50 hours of playback on a full charge. Better yet, 10 minutes of charging can replenish five hours of listening time.

If you're looking for a stocking-stuffer, the Amazon Echo Buds with ANC are on sale for only $35. Alternatively, the Anker Soundcore P20i and P30i earbuds are down to $20 and $25 each, and a set of Tozo T6 earbuds are available for $21 (was $43). These are fine for their price, and while you can use them to listen to a few tunes, they're not exactly audiophile-grade hardware.

On the gaming side, there are some nice models available that combine powerful technology with a slick design. PlayStation's Pulse Explore earbuds are on sale for $170 (was $200). These offer full support for the console's Tempest 3D Audio and several other gaming-focused features Alternatively, there's Sony's Inzone Buds, which are designed for PC but have full compatibility with PS5. The Inzone Buds have superb ANC, so they are worth checking out if you want gaming earbuds that block out noise.

There's also the Asus ROG Cetra, easily the best-looking gaming earbuds on the market, and these ones have a powerful battery life, hybrid active noise-canceling technology, and work across multiple platforms like PC, PS5, Nintendo Switch, and mobile devices.

Black Friday earbuds on Sale

  • Beats Studio Buds -- $80 ($150)
  • Beats Studio Buds+ -- $130 ($170)
  • Beats Studio3 Headphones -- $89 ($159)
  • Beats Solo 4 Headphones -- $100 ($200)
  • JBL Live Pro 2 Earbuds -- $75 ($150)
  • Samsung Galaxy Buds FE -- $58 ($100)
  • Amazon Echo Buds with Active Noise Cancellation -- $35 ($120)
  • Amazon Echo Buds (2023) -- $25 ($50)
  • JBL Vibe Beam -- $25 ($50)
  • Anker Soundcore P20i -- $20 ($40)
  • Anker Soundcore P30i -- $25 ($50)
  • Tozo T6 -- $21 ($43)

Black Friday gaming earbuds on sale

  • Sony Inzone Buds -- $168 ($200)
  • Pulse Explore earbuds -- $170 ($200)
  • Asus ROG Cetra (White) -- $70 ($100)
  • Asus ROG Cetra (Black) -- $80 ($100)

item.title: Sledgehammer Games Reportedly Leading Development On 2027's Call Of Duty
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/sledgehammer-games-reportedly-leading-development-on-2027s-call-of-duty/1100-6528047/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Earlier this month, a report emerged that Microsoft was forming a new committee within Activision to guide the future of the Call of Duty franchise. Now, that future may be coming into focus as a new report suggests that Sledgehammer Games will be taking the lead on Call of Duty's 2027 release.

TheGhostOfHope--a Call of Duty leaker who has accurately reported on previous developments in the franchise--is reporting that Sledgehammer Games' next Call of Duty game will follow Infinity Ward's 2026 title, "which is presumably [Modern Warfare 4]." Hope also stated that Sledgehammer Games' COD is possibly Advanced Warfare 2 or "something new."

What I am hearing about Sledgehammer Games future with Call of Duty:
Sledgehammer Games are currently slated to lead their own Call Of Duty in 2027. This comes after Infinity Ward's game in 2026 which is presumably MW4.
COD2027 is currently NOT a Year 2 Modern Warfare game… pic.twitter.com/xR3UYwsjfm

— Hope (@TheGhostOfHope) November 24, 2024

Because Activision releases new Call of Duty games annually, a number of the publisher's smaller development studios are working on concurrent projects in order to maintain that pace. Sledgehammer Games has assisted other Activision studios on several Call of Duty games, while leading development on a handful of its own titles, including 2023's Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3.

Last month's Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 release set records for the franchise, according to Activision. The publisher credits Black Ops 6's availability on Game Pass, consoles, and PC for lifting its 30-day launch period to all-time highs in total players, total hours played, and total matches played. The game also added some fresh touches to the franchise, including DLC that gives players the ability to suit up as a shark. Activision launched Ranked Play for Black Ops 6 earlier this month, which gives the best players a chance to go head-to-head using the same settings, maps, modes, and weapon restrictions as COD's official esports league.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: A New Premium Metroid Prime Trilogy Art Book Is Launching Next Year
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/a-new-premium-metroid-prime-trilogy-art-book-is-launching-next-year/1100-6528042/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

2025 is going to be a massive year for Metroid Prime. Not only is the long-awaited Metroid Prime 4: Beyond finally launching on Nintendo Switch, but now fans can look forward to a new, official art book covering the original trilogy from premium game-guide publisher Piggyback. Metroid Prime 1-3: A Visual Retrospective is a 212-page hardcover edition launching in Summer 2025. It's available to preorder at Amazon for $48.44.

According to Piggbyback's official announcement, the publisher worked directly with Nintendo and Retro Studios to create Metroid Prime 1-3: A Visual Retrospective. The book will feature "concept drawings, sketches, and assorted illustrations" from the original Metroid Prime, Prime 2: Echoes, Prime 3: Corruption, and the recent Metroid Prime Remastered on Switch. The art is presented alongside "exclusive commentary from Nintendo producer Kensuke Tanabe, as well as the esteemed Retro Studios." Tanabe also contributed a foreword to the book and each section features written intros from Retro Studios staff. The hardcover book is printed on premium, sheet-fed art paper with stitch binding and etched metallic foil cover art featuring Samus Aran's iconic Varia suit.

The Official Art and Making of Metroid Prime 1-3 will launch for $50 sometime in Summer 2025. Amazon's listing states July 31, but that is likely a placeholder date.

If Piggyback's other books are any indication, Metroid fans are in for a treat. Not only is it rare for Nintendo games to get this sort of behind-the-scenes examination, but Piggyback is behind some of the coolest game guides of the last several years, including the official guides for The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom--both of which are some of the coolest Zelda collector's items currently available. Other highlights include Piggyback's guides for Cyberpunk 2077 and the upcoming official Assassin's Creed Shadows.

More Video Game Book Deals

For anyone curious about Piggyback's other work, several of the company's books are discounted at Amazon right now, including both Zelda guides. The Breath of the Wild Expanded Guide is just $22.85 (was $45) and the Tears of the Kingdom Collector's Edition Guide is $26.85 (was $45). Both include unique cover art and lots of collectible materials. The Zelda guides are also part of Amazon's Buy Two Get One promotion on books, and if you're looking for more Zelda material to round out the B2G1 deal, The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia is eligible for the deal and available for $20.60 (was $40). Piggyback's Cyberpunk 2077 Collector's Edition Guide is also part of the B2G1 sale and discounted to $22 (was $40).

There are several more Black Friday deals on gaming books available at Amazon. While they're not part of the B2G1 deal, the Dark Horse-published Zelda lore books are all roughly 50% off right now, including Hyrule Historia for $23.60 (was $40) and Creating a Champion Hero's Edition for $59.50 (was $110). You can also grab Nintendo's official The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia Deluxe Edition for $48 (was $90). You'll find a list of more Zelda book deals below.

  • Cyberpunk 2077 Collector's Edition Guide -- $20.60 ($40) B2G1
  • Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Collector's Edition Guide -- $26.85 ($45) B2G1
  • Zelda: Breath of the Wild Expanded Guide -- $22.26 ($40) B2G1
  • The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia -- $20.60 ($40) B2G1
  • The Legend of Zelda: Arts & Artifacts -- $18.31 ($50)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Creating A Champion Hero's Edition -- $59.50 ($110)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Hyrule Historia -- $23.60 ($40)
  • The Legend of Zelda Encyclopedia Deluxe Edition -- $48 ($90)

More Metroid Deals

Lastly, for anyone who wants to check out Samus' most recent adventure, you can pick up Metroid Dread for $47 (was $60) in Walmart's big Black Friday Nintendo sale. You can pair that with a deal on the Metroid Dread Amiibo Two-Pack that includes Samus and the E.M.M.I. Amiibo figures at Amazon. Amazon also has a bunch of awesome Metroid apparel on sale, too.
